intro: Satureja lindeniana, commonly known as Lindenberg's savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple or pink. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Satureja lindeniana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
